intro: Tragacantha gompholobium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with slender, linear leaflets and produces yellow flowers in spikes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Tragacantha gompholobium is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
